sentences.en: A scholar prefers death to humiliation.
Criminals are given the option of going to jail or facing public humiliation.
sentences.cn: 罪犯可以选择要么坐牢，要么遭受当众羞辱。

sentences.en: He is constantly on guard against any threat of humiliation.
sentences.cn: 他时刻提防着任何有辱尊严之事。

sentences.en: He left in a rage of humiliation.
He made me drink the cup of humiliation to the very dregs.
sentences.cn: 他叫我一滴不剩地饮干了耻辱之酒.

sentences.en: He will wish to revenge his humiliation in last Season's Final.
sentences.cn: 他会为在上个季度的决赛中所受的耻辱而报复的.

sentences.en: It will be difficult to live down this humiliation.
sentences.cn: 忘记这样的耻辱是困难的.

sentences.en: Only a few go through the final humiliation of meeting the bailiff at the door.
sentences.cn: 很少有人经受执达官上门的奇耻大辱。

sentences.en: She blushed to her hair line and her humiliation was complete.
sentences.cn: 她的脸顿时涨得通红,心里感到莫大的侮辱.

sentences.en: She could see only outrage and humiliation, leering at her, mocking her.
sentences.cn: 她看见那个奇耻大辱就站在她的面前, 带着狞笑看她, 讥笑她.

sentences.en: The deliberate public humiliation was too much for me.
sentences.cn: 蓄意把我当众羞辱是太过分了.

sentences.en: the humiliation of having to ask her parents for money
sentences.cn: 不得不开口伸手向她父母要钱的难堪

sentences.en: The result is a humiliation for the prime minister.
There was always a special brand of humiliation in them.
sentences.cn: 事事都带有这么一种特殊的屈辱的味道.

sentences.en: They frequently plumb the depths of loneliness, humiliation and despair.
sentences.cn: 他们常常陷入孤独、屈辱和绝望的深渊。

sentences.en: To her the humiliation seemed dreadful.
sentences.cn: 这种羞怒对她来说是可怕的.

words.tran_cn: 屈辱（humiliate的过去式）；使…丢脸，使…蒙羞

trans.tran_cn: 羞辱：使（别人）丢脸的行动，羞辱，耻辱，丢脸，丢人
trans.tran_en: a feeling of shame and great embarrassment, because you have been made to look stupid or weak
